skill.name: brand-guidelines
skill.description: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit from having Anthropic's look-and-feel. Use it when brand colors or style guidelines, visual formatting, or company design standards apply.
skill.summary: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit fr...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: This is an official Anthropic skill containing only documentation and brand guidelines. No executable code, external dependencies, or security concerns identified.

content.value_statement: Automatically applies Anthropic's official brand colors, typography, and visual identity to presentations, documents, and other artifacts for consistent professional styling.
actual_capabilities: Applies Anthropic's official color palette (dark #141413, light #faf9f5, accents orange/blue/green)
Automatically sets Poppins font for headings (24pt+) with Arial fallback
Applies Lora font to body text with Georgia fallback
Smart color selection based on background contrast
Cycles accent colors (orange, blue, green) for non-text shapes
Works with python-pptx for PowerPoint presentations
Maintains brand fidelity with RGB color values
limitations: Requires Poppins and Lora fonts pre-installed for optimal results (falls back to Arial/Georgia)
Primarily designed for PowerPoint artifacts via python-pptx
Font application limited to headings (24pt+) and body text distinction
Cannot install fonts automatically - relies on system fonts
May not support all artifact types beyond presentations

use_cases.title: Brand-Compliant Presentations
use_cases.description: Create PowerPoint presentations that automatically follow Anthropic's brand guidelines with proper colors, fonts, and styling
use_cases.target_user: Marketing teams, business development, executive communications

use_cases.title: Corporate Document Styling
use_cases.description: Apply consistent Anthropic visual identity to reports, proposals, and external-facing documents

use_cases.title: Visual Asset Formatting
use_cases.description: Ensure visual materials maintain brand consistency with official color schemes and typography

output_examples.input: Create a presentation about AI safety using Anthropic branding
output_examples.output:
PowerPoint presentation with:
- Headings in Poppins font (24pt+)
- Body text in Lora font
- Dark (#141413) and light (#faf9f5) backgrounds
- Orange (#d97757), blue (#6a9bcc), green (#788c5d) accent shapes
- Proper contrast and readability

best_practices: Pre-install Poppins and Lora fonts in your environment for best visual results
Use the skill for external-facing materials that represent Anthropic
Let the skill handle font selection automatically based on text size (24pt+ for headings)
Trust the accent color cycling for visual variety while maintaining brand consistency
Verify font rendering if custom fonts unavailable - fallbacks to Arial/Georgia maintain readability
anti_patterns: Manually overriding brand colors with custom values
Applying the skill to internal-only documents that don't need brand compliance
Expecting font installation - the skill uses available system fonts only
Using the skill for non-visual artifacts (code, data files, etc.)
Mixing Anthropic brand guidelines with other corporate identities

faq.question: What fonts does this skill use?
faq.answer: Poppins for headings (24pt and larger) and Lora for body text, with automatic fallbacks to Arial and Georgia respectively if the custom fonts aren't installed.

faq.question: Do I need to install fonts separately?
faq.answer: For best results, yes - pre-install Poppins and Lora fonts in your environment. However, the skill will work with fallback fonts (Arial/Georgia) if they're not available.

faq.question: What are Anthropic's official brand colors?
faq.answer: Main colors: Dark (#141413), Light (#faf9f5), Mid Gray (#b0aea5), Light Gray (#e8e6dc). Accent colors: Orange (#d97757), Blue (#6a9bcc), Green (#788c5d).

faq.question: What types of artifacts does this work with?
faq.answer: Primarily PowerPoint presentations via python-pptx. The skill applies brand colors and typography to visual elements that benefit from Anthropic's look-and-feel.

faq.question: How does the skill choose which accent color to use?
faq.answer: For non-text shapes, the skill cycles through the three accent colors (orange, blue, green) to maintain visual interest while staying on-brand.
